subtitles.chinese: 他告訴我，他通過電子遊戲與侄子侄女的聯繫比世界上任何其他方式都多。

subtitles.english: Before you judge him too harshly, you need to understand that Uncle Amos lives in New Zealand.
subtitles.chinese: 在你過於嚴厲地評判他之前，你需要了解阿莫斯叔叔住在新西蘭。

subtitles.english: Before he was in New Zealand, he lived in Germany.
subtitles.chinese: 在來新西蘭之前，他住在德國。

subtitles.english: So the entire time that my kids have been around, they've never known Uncle Amos.
subtitles.chinese: 所以我的孩子們一直在身邊，他們從來不認識阿莫斯叔叔。

subtitles.english: They've never been in the same country as him.
subtitles.chinese: 他們從來沒有和他在同一個國家。

subtitles.english: He would not get an hour-long phone call from my kids.
subtitles.chinese: 他不會接到我孩子們打來的長達一個小時的電話。

subtitles.english: But hopping on "Fortnite," playing games together, making memories together.
subtitles.chinese: 但跳上《堡壘之夜》，一起玩遊戲，一起創造回憶。

subtitles.english: Maybe learning how absolutely feral my middle son is.
subtitles.chinese: 也許知道我的二兒子是多麼的野性。

subtitles.english: It's a game changer.
subtitles.chinese: 這是一個遊戲規則的改變者。

subtitles.english: Now, you might be sitting there wondering, what is esports?
subtitles.chinese: 現在，您可能坐在那裡想知道，什麼是電子競技？

subtitles.english: Luckily, it's pretty simple.
subtitles.chinese: 幸運的是，這非常簡單。

subtitles.english: Esports are just competitive video games.
subtitles.chinese: 電子競技只是競技電子遊戲。

subtitles.english: Anything can be an esport if it's a competitive digital game.
subtitles.chinese: 只要是有競爭力的數字遊戲，任何東西都可以是電子競技。

subtitles.english: Games like "Fortnite," shooter games like that can be an esport, or games like chess can be an esport if it's played with computers.
subtitles.chinese: 像《堡壘之夜》這樣的遊戲、射擊遊戲都可以是電子競技，或者像國際象棋這樣的遊戲如果用電腦玩的話也可以是電子競技。

subtitles.english: What ties them all together is that they're all competitive.
subtitles.chinese: 將它們聯繫在一起的是它們都具有競爭力。

subtitles.english: If you have ever talked to a child, like ever in your life, you've probably heard of games like "Mario Kart," "Fortnite," "Rocket League."
subtitles.chinese: 如果您曾經與孩子交談過，就像您一生中的任何時候一樣，您可能聽說過“馬里奧賽車”、“堡壘之夜”、“火箭聯盟”等遊戲。

subtitles.english: All esports or electronic sports.
subtitles.chinese: 所有電子競技或電子競技。

subtitles.english: But do not call them electronic sports
subtitles.chinese: 但不要稱其為電子競技

subtitles.english: because you will lose all of your street cred, especially with your children.
subtitles.chinese: 因為你將失去所有的街頭信譽，尤其是在你的孩子麵前。

subtitles.english: Trust me on that one.
subtitles.chinese: 相信我這一點。

subtitles.english: And it's not just my kids who get to have this experience now,
subtitles.chinese: 現在不只是我的孩子有這種經歷

subtitles.english: because the state of South Dakota this year sanctioned esports as a high school activity.
subtitles.chinese: 因為南達科他州今年批准電子競技作為高中活動。

subtitles.english: Yeah, that's pretty great.
subtitles.chinese: 是的，那太棒了。

subtitles.english: (Applause) So right now, kids are playing esports teams within the four walls of schools in South Dakota.
subtitles.chinese: （掌聲）現在，孩子們正在南達科他州學校的四圍牆內參加電子競技隊比賽。

subtitles.english: This is important because these kids are not just playing, they're practicing,
subtitles.chinese: 這很重要，因為這些孩子不僅僅是在玩耍，他們還在練習，

subtitles.english: they're practicing and gaining skills that they will use for the rest of their lives.
subtitles.chinese: 他們正在練習並獲得終生受用的技能。

subtitles.english: Skills like leadership, teamwork, communication, strategy, and the ability to handle tough emotions.
subtitles.chinese: 領導力、團隊合作、溝通、策略以及處理艱難情緒的能力等技能。

subtitles.english: So fast forward to these same kids starting their careers.
subtitles.chinese: 快進到這些同樣的孩子開始他們的職業生涯。

subtitles.english: Businesses also get to benefit from the skills that kids have gained in high school and in college.
subtitles.chinese: 企業還可以從孩子們在高中和大學獲得的技能中受益。

subtitles.english: And in that same vein, we can talk about the inclusivity of esports.
subtitles.chinese: 同樣，我們可以談論電子競技的包容性。

subtitles.english: I challenge you to think of a more inclusive sport anywhere in the world.
subtitles.chinese: 我挑戰你想出一種在世界任何地方都更具包容性的運動。

subtitles.english: It doesn't matter your age, your background, or your ability.
subtitles.chinese: 你的年齡、你的背景或你的能力並不重要。

subtitles.english: Anyone can play, compete, grow and win in esports.
subtitles.chinese: 任何人都可以在電子競技中玩耍、競爭、成長並獲勝。

subtitles.english: Of course, there's other benefits that I didn't notice until I got further into this with my children.
subtitles.chinese: 當然，還有其他好處，直到我和孩子們進一步深入研究後才注意到。

subtitles.english: I understand that as a parent,
subtitles.chinese: 我明白，作為父母，

subtitles.english: video games and esports are kind of a complicated subject
subtitles.chinese: 視頻遊戲和電子競技是一個複雜的主題

subtitles.english: because we fear the communication that happens within these spaces, especially because sometimes our kids are talking to strangers.
subtitles.chinese: 因為我們害怕在這些空間內發生的交流，特別是因為有時我們的孩子會與陌生人交談。

subtitles.english: I think that that's a valid fear.
subtitles.chinese: 我認為這是一種合理的恐懼。

subtitles.english: And I understand now, when I joined my kids in this space,
subtitles.chinese: 我現在明白了，當我和我的孩子們一起進入這個空間時，

subtitles.english: I got to learn with them and helped teach them how to navigate this space.
subtitles.chinese: 我必須和他們一起學習，並幫助教他們如何駕馭這個領域。

subtitles.english: I also learned that it's not just scary.
subtitles.chinese: 我還了解到這不僅僅是可怕的。

subtitles.english: There's joy in these spaces because this is a shared space and we can have shared experiences here.
subtitles.chinese: 這些空間充滿歡樂，因為這是一個共享空間，我們可以在這里分享經驗。

subtitles.english: When I was there with them, I got a first-hand glimpse into their world,
subtitles.chinese: 當我和他們在一起時，我親眼目睹了他們的世界，

subtitles.english: and I learned how to better protect them and help them through this space.
subtitles.chinese: 我學會瞭如何更好地保護他們並幫助他們渡過難關。

subtitles.english: In fact, video games even helped me when it was time to introduce my kids to someone new.
subtitles.chinese: 事實上，當我需要向我的孩子介紹新朋友時，電子遊戲甚至對我很有幫助。

subtitles.english: As a single parent, it can be kind of awkward to introduce your kids to your significant other.
subtitles.chinese: 作為單親家長，將您的孩子介紹給您的另一半可能會有點尷尬。

subtitles.english: So a couple months before we introduced our families, we all hopped on Fortnite to play together.
subtitles.chinese: 因此，在我們介紹家人之前的幾個月，我們都跳上《堡壘之夜》一起玩。

subtitles.english: This is a life hack, I am serious.
subtitles.chinese: 這是生活小竅門，我是認真的。

subtitles.english: So we, his kids and my kids and us all jumped on Fortnite together
subtitles.chinese: 所以我們、他的孩子、我的孩子和我們一起跳上《堡壘之夜》

subtitles.english: and it was pretty awesome because there was no pressure of like,
subtitles.chinese: 這真是太棒了，因為沒有類似的壓力，

subtitles.english: if we didn't have something to talk about, we're just playing a game, we don't have to talk.
subtitles.chinese: 如果我們沒有什麼可談的，我們只是在玩遊戲，我們不需要說話。

subtitles.english: If things weren't going so great, we could just dip.
subtitles.chinese: 如果事情進展不那麼順利，我們就可以下跌。

subtitles.english: We didn't have to stay for any certain amount of time.
subtitles.chinese: 我們不必停留任何特定的時間。

subtitles.english: I got to see how he responded to my kids' silly, competitive or sometimes a little bit feral nature.
subtitles.chinese: 我要看看他如何應對我孩子們愚蠢、好勝、有時甚至有點野性的天性。

subtitles.english: And I also got to see how he responded to his children if they were upset or being critical with each other.
subtitles.chinese: 我還看到，如果孩子們感到不安或互相批評，他會如何應對。

subtitles.english: And then, when the time came for us to introduce our families in person, we all had something to talk about.
subtitles.chinese: 然後，當我們親自介紹我們的家人時，我們都有話要說。

subtitles.english: And maybe this idea isn't so new after all.
subtitles.chinese: 也許這個想法畢竟並不新鮮。

subtitles.english: Because back when I was a kid,
subtitles.chinese: 因為小時候，

subtitles.english: my parents told me that TV would rot our brains and threw our TV into the trash.
subtitles.chinese: 我的父母告訴我電視會腐蝕我們的大腦，並將我們的電視扔進垃圾桶。

subtitles.english: Growing up in rural South Dakota in the '90s, I really didn't miss our TV that much.
subtitles.chinese: 我在 20 世紀 90 年代在南達科他州的鄉村長大，真的不太想念我們的電視。

subtitles.english: If you grew up in South Dakota in the wild, wild west
subtitles.chinese: 如果你在南達科他州的狂野西部長大

subtitles.english: or east, in my case, of South Dakota in the '90s, you probably have a pretty good idea about what we got up to.
subtitles.chinese: 或者以我為例，在 20 世紀 90 年代的南達科他州東部，您可能對我們所做的事情有一個很好的了解。

subtitles.english: If not, let me paint you a picture.
subtitles.chinese: 如果沒有的話，我給你畫一幅畫。

subtitles.english: Imagine trying to ride cattle in a field.
subtitles.chinese: 想像一下嘗試在田野裡騎牛。

subtitles.english: Maybe climbing up to the second-story roof of an outbuilding in the winter to hop on your sled and go screaming down the other side?
subtitles.chinese: 也許在冬天爬到附屬建築的二樓屋頂，跳上雪橇，尖叫著沖向另一邊？

subtitles.english: Or maybe the timeless tradition of daring your city slicker friends
subtitles.chinese: 或者也許是向你的城市狡猾的朋友發起挑戰的永恆傳統

subtitles.english: to touch the electric fence, knowing full well how that will feel because you yourself have touched the electric fence a time or two.
subtitles.chinese: 觸摸電圍欄，充分了解那會是什麼感覺，因為您自己已經觸摸過電圍欄一兩次。

subtitles.english: But these are all memorable parts of my childhood and stories for another day.
subtitles.chinese: 但這些都是我童年難忘的部分，也是以後的故事。

subtitles.english: But I will never forget the Christmas that my parents surprised us with a Nintendo 64.
subtitles.chinese: 但我永遠不會忘記那個聖誕節，我的父母給我們帶來了一台 Nintendo 64 給我們帶來了驚喜。

subtitles.english: This gorgeous electronic came with four controllers, and it turns out my parents didn't throw our TV away.
subtitles.chinese: 這個華麗的電子產品配有四個控制器，事實證明我的父母並沒有扔掉我們的電視。

subtitles.english: They just put it in storage.
subtitles.chinese: 他們只是將其存放起來。

subtitles.english: So they brought that old box down and we all got to sit down and play together.
subtitles.chinese: 所以他們把那個舊盒子拿下來，我們大家坐下來一起玩。

subtitles.english: It was a blast playing with my brothers and sometimes I even won.
subtitles.chinese: 和我的兄弟們一起玩真是太棒了，有時我什至贏了。

subtitles.english: Like I said, I was pretty good at Diddy Kong Racing.
subtitles.chinese: 就像我說的，我在 Diddy Kong Racing 上表現得非常好。

subtitles.english: But the true joy came when we would get to connect with my dad.
subtitles.chinese: 但當我們能夠與父親取得聯繫時，真正的快樂就來了。

subtitles.english: You see, my dad had two distinct sides to his personality.
subtitles.chinese: 你看，我父親的性格有兩個截然不同的方面。

subtitles.english: On one side, he was pretty strict and serious and a disciplinarian, which I understand,
subtitles.chinese: 一方面，他非常嚴格、嚴肅，是一個紀律嚴明的人，我理解這一點，

subtitles.english: he was raising a gaggle of children, so that can kind of be expected.
subtitles.chinese: 他正在撫養一群孩子，所以這是可以預料到的。

subtitles.english: But on the other side of him, he was playful and carefree and absolutely hilarious.
subtitles.chinese: 但在他的另一面，他卻很頑皮、無憂無慮、非常搞笑。

subtitles.english: And when we all got to race and play together, this is the part of him that we got to see.
subtitles.chinese: 當我們一起比賽和玩耍時，這就是我們看到的他的一部分。

subtitles.english: My brother Ezra told me a story
subtitles.chinese: 我哥哥以斯拉給我講了一個故事

subtitles.english: about one day he was sitting at home playing "Halo," and Dad came home on his lunch break.
subtitles.chinese: 大約有一天，他坐在家裡玩“光環”，爸爸午休時回家。

subtitles.english: Dad sat down and started playing with him and pretty soon, half an hour goes past.
subtitles.chinese: 爸爸坐下來和他一起玩，很快，半個小時就過去了。

subtitles.english: Then an hour, and then it's two hours later.
subtitles.chinese: 然後一個小時，然後兩個小時後。

subtitles.english: And finally, Ezra is like, “Dad, don’t you have to be at work?
subtitles.chinese: 最後，以斯拉說：“爸爸，你不用上班嗎？

subtitles.english: ” And Dad said, “Work can wait.
subtitles.chinese: ” 爸爸說：“工作可以等一等。

subtitles.english: We're saving the world right now."
subtitles.chinese: 我們現在正在拯救世界。 ”

subtitles.english: (Laughter) My dad didn't really like video games.
subtitles.chinese: （笑聲） 我爸爸不太喜歡電子遊戲。

subtitles.english: He didn't really -- He didn't like them, nor was he good at them.
subtitles.chinese: 他並不真的——他不喜歡它們，也不擅長它們。

subtitles.english: But he chose to connect with us there because that's where we were.
subtitles.chinese: 但他選擇在那裡與我們聯繫，因為那是我們所在的地方。

subtitles.english: He chose to speak our language even though he didn't really like it.
subtitles.chinese: 他選擇說我們的語言，儘管他並不真正喜歡它。

subtitles.english: Now that he's been gone for eight years, I wish that we could make more of those memories with my kids and with us.
subtitles.chinese: 現在他已經離開八年了，我希望我們能和我的孩子們以及我們自己留下更多這樣的回憶。

subtitles.english: And as a mother now, I draw from those experiences as much as I can.
subtitles.chinese: 現在作為一名母親，我盡可能地從這些經歷中吸取教訓。

subtitles.english: Whenever my kids ask me to play "Fortnite" or "Minecraft" with them,
subtitles.chinese: 每當我的孩子要求我和他們一起玩“Fortnite”或“Minecraft”時，

subtitles.english: it doesn't matter how busy I am, I never regret sitting down and playing with them.
subtitles.chinese: 不管我有多忙，我從不後悔坐下來和他們一起玩。

subtitles.english: Video games have surprised me in so many ways,
subtitles.chinese: 電子遊戲在很多方面都讓我感到驚訝，

subtitles.english: from schools creating a sense of belonging for kids who wouldn't otherwise have that,
subtitles.chinese: 學校為孩子們創造了一種歸屬感，否則他們不會有這種歸屬感，

subtitles.english: to teaching them skills for their lives that they will use for the rest of their lives.
subtitles.chinese: 教給他們終生受益的技能。

subtitles.english: From my dad playing with us growing up and me playing with my children,
subtitles.chinese: 從我爸爸和我們一起長大，到我和我的孩子們一起玩耍，

subtitles.english: when I speak of esports, people come out of the woodwork to share their stories with me.
subtitles.chinese: 當我談到電子競技時，人們會突然冒出來與我分享他們的故事。

subtitles.english: Not stories of sitting in a basement and chugging energy drinks.
subtitles.chinese: 不是坐在地下室喝能量飲料的故事。

subtitles.english: Stories about connection.
subtitles.chinese: 關於聯繫的故事。

subtitles.english: That's what brings this all together.
subtitles.chinese: 這就是將這一切結合在一起的原因。

subtitles.english: When I began pondering how I would share this story about esports with you all,
subtitles.chinese: 當我開始思考如何與大家分享這個關於電子競技的故事時，

subtitles.english: I realized if I wouldn't have said yes when my kids asked me to play "Fortnite," none of this would have happened.
subtitles.chinese: 我意識到，當我的孩子們邀請我玩《堡壘之夜》時，如果我不答應，這一切都不會發生。

subtitles.english: I said yes to them,
subtitles.chinese: 我對他們說是的，

subtitles.english: and then my boss asked me if I would drive up
subtitles.chinese: 然後我的老闆問我是否願意開車過去

subtitles.english: to northern Minnesota to research this esports competition and see what it would take to make that happen here in Sioux Falls.
subtitles.chinese: 前往明尼蘇達州北部研究這項電子競技比賽，看看如何才能在蘇福爾斯實現這一目標。

subtitles.english: I started learning from and with my colleagues about how to build this right here in Sioux Falls.
subtitles.chinese: 我開始向同事學習如何在蘇福爾斯建造這個項目。

subtitles.english: And then last September, I got to co-lead South Dakota's first all-ages free esports competition
subtitles.chinese: 去年九月，我共同領導了南達科他州首屆全年齡段免費電子競技比賽

subtitles.english: in Sioux Falls, and our board of directors has agreed to bring it back for round two this October.
subtitles.chinese: 在蘇福爾斯，我們的董事會已同意今年 10 月將其帶回第二輪。

subtitles.english: (Cheers and applause) And now, today, I'm standing here on this TEDx stage.
subtitles.chinese: （歡呼和掌聲）現在，今天，我站在這個 TEDx 舞台上。

subtitles.english: Somewhere I never saw myself in a million years.
subtitles.chinese: 一百萬年來我從未在某個地方見過自己。

subtitles.english: But this whole journey started with wanting to connect with my sons.
subtitles.chinese: 但這整個旅程都是從想要與我的兒子們建立聯繫開始的。

subtitles.english: And ultimately, that's who I'm still trying to connect with.
subtitles.chinese: 最終，這就是我仍在嘗試聯繫的人。

subtitles.english: What I found through flailing around Fortnite, saying yes to unexpected opportunities,
subtitles.chinese: 我在《堡壘之夜》中摸索，對意想不到的機會說“是”時發現，

subtitles.english: and learning alongside my children is that connection is always worth it, even if you don't know how to open the door.
subtitles.chinese: 和我的孩子們一起學習的是，即使你不知道如何打開門，聯繫總是值得的。

subtitles.english: My sons are who I keep saying yes to,
subtitles.chinese: 我一直對我的兒子說“是”

subtitles.english: and I would say, the best unexpected benefit of all -- my kids legitimately think I'm cool.
subtitles.chinese: 我想說，最意想不到的好處是——我的孩子們理所當然地認為我很酷。

subtitles.english: Most of the medicines that we use to treat diseases today work by interacting with just one type of protein in the body at a time.

subtitles.english: My team and I at AI Proteins are focused

subtitles.english: We call them miniproteins.

subtitles.english: These are peptides, 40 to 60 amino acids long, that fold into three dimensional shapes, much like a protein does.

subtitles.english: Using generative artificial intelligence, we design our miniproteins from scratch, and this allows us to control everything about them.

subtitles.english: We design them to be small because this helps them to get around inside the body.

subtitles.english: We design them to be nice and stable.

subtitles.english: We’ve shown the power of miniproteins by taking mice, giving them arthritis, and treating their joint inflammation.

subtitles.english: The next step is to bring this technology and our pipeline of transformative new medicines to patients.

subtitles.chinese: 你知道，我花了一個星期的時間，這個故事是如此令人難以置信的奇幻。

subtitles.chinese: 暗網刺客，你知道的，殺戮命令，我已經掛了一個星期了。

subtitles.english: So we knew we needed to evolve our strategy and quickly.
subtitles.chinese: 所以我們知道我們需要快速發展我們的戰略。

subtitles.chinese: 所以我們請了當地記者到現場。

subtitles.chinese: 他們相信我們可以直接去見見殺戮名單上的人。

subtitles.english: And the first place we tried to do this was to reach a woman called Elena, here in Zurich, on the outskirts of Zurich.

subtitles.chinese: 我和當地記者交談，她開車去了埃琳娜住的地方，

subtitles.english: she took a deep breath, she got out her car and knocked on Elena's front door.
subtitles.chinese: 她深吸了一口氣，下了車，敲了敲埃琳娜的前門。

subtitles.chinese: 5 分鐘變成了 10 分鐘，10 分鐘變成了 15 分鐘。

subtitles.chinese: 最後，經過一段痛苦的等待，埃琳娜接到了 Zoom 電話，

subtitles.english: a woman whose face I'd only seen on a kill order, was there speaking to me.
subtitles.chinese: 一個我只在殺戮令上見過的女人正在對我說話。

subtitles.chinese: 墨虎愷：真的嗎？以什麼方式？

subtitles.chinese: （笑聲）現在要知道的一件重要的事情是，進入網站的不僅僅是消息。

subtitles.english: The shadowy people running the site were also replying.
subtitles.chinese: 運營該網站的神秘人士也做出了回應。

subtitles.english: Some of these conversations would go back and forth for weeks or months, and we could read all of those as well.
subtitles.chinese: 其中一些對話會持續數週或數月，我們也可以閱讀所有這些內容。

subtitles.english: And what we realized when we were reading all of those
subtitles.chinese: 當我們閱讀所有這些內容時我們意識到

subtitles.english: was that if there were hitmen out there, these were the most incompetent hitmen on the face of the planet.
subtitles.chinese: 如果世界上真的有殺手的話，那麼他們就是地球上最無能的殺手。

subtitles.english: They kept losing their weapons, or they kept getting lost.
subtitles.chinese: 他們不斷丟失武器，或者不斷迷路。

subtitles.english: It would build up to the hit,
subtitles.chinese: 它會積累人氣，

subtitles.chinese: 突然之間目標就會受到很好的保護

subtitles.chinese: 他們必須退出，新的球隊必須加入，而每次價格都會上漲。

subtitles.english: It became really obvious that there were no shadowy hitmen out there.
subtitles.chinese: 很明顯，那裡沒有影子殺手。

subtitles.chinese: 該網站無意殺死這些人中的任何一個。

subtitles.english: They were just trying to extort as much money as they could from the people placing the orders.
subtitles.chinese: 他們只是想從下訂單的人那裡勒索盡可能多的錢。

subtitles.english: But the people placing the orders, they, of course, did not know that.
subtitles.chinese: 但下訂單的人當然不知道這一點。

subtitles.english: They were deadly serious when they were trying to have these people killed.
subtitles.chinese: 當他們試圖殺死這些人時，他們是非常嚴肅的。

subtitles.english: And nowhere was that lesson starker than actually with Elena herself.
subtitles.chinese: 這個教訓在埃琳娜本人身上體現得最為明顯。

subtitles.english: So after we spoke to Elena, we spoke to the police.
subtitles.chinese: 因此，在我們與埃琳娜交談後，我們又與警方交談。

subtitles.english: And sometime after that, the Swiss police did arrest her husband.
subtitles.chinese: 此後不久，瑞士警方逮捕了她的丈夫。

subtitles.english: And only then did we realize that he'd been renting a secret room next to her flat.
subtitles.chinese: 直到那時我們才意識到他一直在她公寓旁邊租了一個秘密房間。

subtitles.english: And in this room there was a flip knife, a telescopic baton, a submachine gun,
subtitles.chinese: 這個房間裡有一把翻刀、一根伸縮警棍、一把衝鋒槍，

subtitles.english: a Glock 9mm pistol, an AK-47, zip ties, a black bin bag, black rubber gloves, GPS trackers, lock picks.
subtitles.chinese: 一把格洛克 9 毫米手槍、一把 AK-47、紮帶、一個黑色垃圾袋、黑色橡膠手套、GPS 跟踪器、撬鎖工具。

subtitles.english: That was a lesson to us if we needed it.
subtitles.chinese: 如果我們需要的話，這對我們來說是一個教訓。

subtitles.english: The people writing these orders could be just as dangerous as any darknet hitman.
subtitles.chinese: 撰寫這些命令的人可能與任何暗網殺手一樣危險。

subtitles.english: So who are these people?
subtitles.chinese: 那麼這些人是誰呢？

subtitles.english: Who are the people writing these orders?
subtitles.chinese: 寫這些命令的人是誰？

subtitles.english: Who is paying 2,200 dollars here for a five-foot-five male with blue eyes to be killed?
subtitles.chinese: 谁愿意花 2,200 美元殺死一個身高 5 英尺 5 英寸、藍眼睛的男性？

subtitles.english: Who?
subtitles.chinese: 世界衛生組織?

subtitles.english: This is who's doing it.
subtitles.chinese: 這是誰在做這件事。

subtitles.english: She's Kelly Harper.
subtitles.chinese: 她是凱莉·哈珀。

subtitles.english: Kelly Harper is a go getter, hospital administrator,
subtitles.chinese: 凱莉·哈珀 (Kelly Harper) 是一位積極進取的醫院管理者，

subtitles.english: one-time college sweetheart of the target of the order,
subtitles.chinese: 訂單目標的大學戀人，

subtitles.english: who'd been locked with him in a bitter, years-long custody battle
subtitles.chinese: 誰和他一起經歷了長達數年的激烈監護權爭奪戰

subtitles.english: that had raged across the courts and the schools and the hospitals of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin.
subtitles.chinese: 這件事席捲了威斯康星州太陽草原的法院、學校和醫院。

subtitles.english: Who's paying 16,000 dollars to have a couple removed?
subtitles.chinese: 谁愿意花 16,000 美元將一對夫婦搬走？

subtitles.english: Someone that they don't "quite see eye-to eye-on something with," which sounds like the understatement of the century.
subtitles.chinese: 他們“在某些事情上意見不一致”的人，這聽起來像是本世紀的輕描淡寫。

subtitles.english: (Laughter) This is a man that's done that, Christopher Pence.
subtitles.chinese: （笑聲）克里斯托弗·彭斯就是這樣做的人。

subtitles.english: Forty-year-old Microsoft IT security technician.
subtitles.chinese: 四十歲的微軟 IT 安全技術員。

subtitles.english: The biological father of 11 children.
subtitles.chinese: 11個孩子的親生父親。

subtitles.english: The adoptive father of five more children.
subtitles.chinese: 另外五個孩子的養父。

subtitles.english: A deeply religious man, actually,
subtitles.chinese: 事實上，一個虔誠的宗教人士，

subtitles.english: who from a large, solitary house in a valley in Utah,
subtitles.chinese: 他來自猶他州山谷中一所孤獨的大房子，

subtitles.english: secretly plotted to have the biological parents of his five adoptive children killed.
subtitles.chinese: 秘密密謀殺害他五個養子的親生父母。

subtitles.english: This order didn't want the target actually killed.
subtitles.chinese: 這個命令並不希望目標真正被殺死。

subtitles.chinese: 該命令希望綁架目標並強迫其吸食海洛因。

subtitles.chinese: 訂購者的暗​​網綽號是“Scar 215”，他們實際上製定了獎勵結構。

subtitles.english: So "an additional 10,000 to permanently withdraw all court motions.
subtitles.chinese: 因此，“額外 10,000 美元永久撤回所有法庭動議。

subtitles.chinese: 額外的 10,000 美元讓她閉嘴不告訴任何人。

subtitles.chinese: 丈夫不知道發生了這種事，”命令中寫道。

subtitles.chinese: 有什麼猜測嗎？

subtitles.chinese: 丈夫肯定知道發生了這件事。

subtitles.english: This is a husband, Dr. Ronald IlG.
subtitles.chinese: 這是一位丈夫，Ronald IlG 博士。

subtitles.english: A neonatologist, a doctor, A man who ran a clinic for vulnerable women with addiction issues.
subtitles.chinese: 一名新生兒科醫生、一名醫生、一名為有成癮問題的弱勢女性經營診所的男子。

subtitles.english: A man who went from a poor rural upbringing in Oregon
subtitles.chinese: 一個出身於俄勒岡州貧困農村的人

subtitles.english: to a senior city clinician,
subtitles.chinese: 一位資深的城市臨床醫生，

subtitles.english: and a man obsessed with controlling all the people in his life, especially the women.
subtitles.chinese: 一個男人痴迷於控制他生命中的所有人，尤其是女人。

subtitles.english: A man so devoid of contrition, that after his conviction,
subtitles.chinese: 一個如此缺乏悔悟的人，在他被定罪後，

subtitles.english: he's been trying to sell the book rights to his life by describing it as "50 Shades of Gray" on steroids.
subtitles.chinese: 他一直試圖通過將其描述為類固醇的“五十度灰”來出售這本書的版權。

subtitles.english: And it wasn't just here.
subtitles.chinese: 而且它不只是在這裡。

subtitles.english: This was a "Sports Direct" love triangle in Milton Keynes.
subtitles.chinese: 這是米爾頓凱恩斯的“體育直通”三角戀。

subtitles.english: This was a woman trying to kill her two parents in Canberra, Australia.
subtitles.chinese: 這是澳大利亞堪培拉一名婦女試圖殺死她的兩個父母。

subtitles.english: We saw orders in Nevada, we saw orders in Tampa, we saw orders in Spain, we saw orders in Italy.
subtitles.chinese: 我們看到了內華達州的訂單，我們看到了坦帕的訂單，我們看到了西​​班牙的訂單，我們看到了意大利的訂單。

subtitles.english: We saw orders almost everywhere.
subtitles.chinese: 我們幾乎到處都看到訂單。

subtitles.english: Now we started working in secret with the FBI, and we were passing all of our orders to the FBI.
subtitles.chinese: 現在我們開始與聯邦調查局秘密合作，並將所有命令傳遞給聯邦調查局。

subtitles.english: To give you a sense of the scale,
subtitles.chinese: 為了讓你感受到規模，

subtitles.english: over the years that we were doing this, we disclosed 175 paid-for kill orders around the world.
subtitles.chinese: 在我們這樣做的這些年裡，我們披露了世界各地 175 個有償殺戮訂單。

subtitles.english: Thirty-two arrests so far, 28 convictions so far, around 180 years of prison time has been sentenced as a result of the investigation so far.
subtitles.chinese: 調查結果顯示，截至目前，已有 32 人被捕，28 人被定罪，被判處約 180 年監禁。

subtitles.english: There's probably more to come.
subtitles.chinese: 可能還會有更多。

subtitles.english: (Applause) Thanks.
subtitles.chinese: （鼓掌）謝謝。

subtitles.english: And in case anyone's wondering, no, we're not still doing this.
subtitles.chinese: 如果有人想知道，不，我們不會繼續這樣做。

subtitles.english: So there's a whole other investigation that we did into the people running the site.
subtitles.chinese: 因此，我們對網站的運行人員進行了另一項調查。

subtitles.english: It turns out very likely that they were a group of Romanian cyber criminals.
subtitles.chinese: 事實證明，他們很可能是一群羅馬尼亞網絡犯罪分子。

subtitles.english: And some years ago, they were then arrested in a rash of raids across Romania.
subtitles.chinese: 幾年前，他們在羅馬尼亞各地的一系列襲擊中被捕。

subtitles.english: We were then locked out the site.
subtitles.chinese: 然後我們就被封鎖了該網站。

subtitles.english: And yet convictions have continued that we had nothing to do with.
subtitles.chinese: 然而人們仍然堅信我們與此事無關。

subtitles.english: And that is the only reason I can stand on this stage today and tell you about any of this.
subtitles.chinese: 這是我今天能夠站在這個講台上向大家講述這些的唯一原因。

subtitles.english: This is, by the way, not a story I really thought I would ever be on a stage and able to tell anyone about.
subtitles.chinese: 順便說一句，我真的以為我不會在舞台上向任何人講述這個故事。

subtitles.english: So it's a spectacular moment for me
subtitles.chinese: 所以這對我來說是一個壯觀的時刻

subtitles.english: to be able to finally, kind of, talk to the world about what we were doing all those long years ago.
subtitles.chinese: 最終能夠與世界談論我們多年前所做的事情。

subtitles.english: But where are we left with?
subtitles.chinese: 但我們還剩下什麼？

subtitles.english: That's, I think, the final idea I want to leave us with.
subtitles.chinese: 我想，這就是我想留給我們的最終想法。

subtitles.english: What does all of this actually really mean?
subtitles.chinese: 這一切究竟意味著什麼？

subtitles.english: When I first started doing this,
subtitles.chinese: 當我第一次開始這樣做時，

subtitles.english: I thought the kinds of cases that we were going to be dealing with
subtitles.chinese: 我認為我們要處理的案件類型

subtitles.english: were going to be to do with maybe organized crime, big drug deals gone awry.
subtitles.chinese: 可能與有組織犯罪、大型毒品交易出了問題有關。

subtitles.english: And I think the reality is somewhat more unsettling than all of that.
subtitles.chinese: 我認為現實比這一切更令人不安。

subtitles.english: What this website seems to do, in the eyes of the orders, at least,
subtitles.chinese: 至少在命令看來，這個網站的作用是：

subtitles.english: is to make taking out a hit on someone
subtitles.chinese: 是讓某人受到打擊

subtitles.english: convenient and clean and safe and easy, whereas it was once difficult and dangerous and scary.
subtitles.chinese: 方便、乾淨、安全、容易，而它曾經是困難、危險和可怕的。

subtitles.english: It's essentially lowered the barriers to entry to ordering an assassination.
subtitles.chinese: 它本質上降低了下令暗殺的准入門檻。

subtitles.english: And I think that that brings us face-to-face with something that is quite disconcerting.
subtitles.chinese: 我認為這讓我們面對一些相當令人不安的事情。

subtitles.english: The people on this list, the Kill List, and the people that put them there are normal people.
subtitles.chinese: 這份名單、殺戮名單上的人和把他們放在那裡的人都是普通人。

subtitles.english: The perpetrators are basically normal people.
subtitles.chinese: 施暴者基本上都是普通人。

subtitles.english: They have jobs, they have friends.
subtitles.chinese: 他們有工作，有朋友。

subtitles.english: They go about living their lives just like you and I, you know,
subtitles.chinese: 他們就像你我一樣過著自己的生活，你知道，

subtitles.english: and they were going about holding all of that down basically at the same time
subtitles.chinese: 他們基本上同時要抑制所有這些

subtitles.english: that they were plotting in secret, constantly, coldly often, to have someone killed.
subtitles.chinese: 他們經常、冷酷地秘密密謀殺害某人。

subtitles.english: I think that if there's one thing that unites them all, it was often intimate partner violence, by the way, spiraling out of control.
subtitles.chinese: 我認為，如果有一件事將他們團結在一起，那就是親密伴侶的暴力，順便說一句，這種暴力逐漸失控。

subtitles.english: And I think the one thing that unites them all is a desire for control,
subtitles.chinese: 我認為將他們團結在一起的一件事就是對控制的渴望，

subtitles.english: a need to have it, an inability to lose it.
subtitles.chinese: 需要擁有它，無法失去它。

subtitles.english: Control of a thing, control of a relationship, of a family, and a willingness ultimately, of course, to kill, to get it back.
subtitles.chinese: 對事物的控制，對關係的控制，對家庭的控制，以及最終的意願，當然，是殺人，把它奪回來。

subtitles.english: But I think that's where we are.
subtitles.chinese: 但我認為這就是我們現在的處境。

subtitles.english: And if there's one thing that I've come away from this whole lurid,
subtitles.chinese: 如果說我從這整個聳人聽聞的事件中擺脫了一件事的話

subtitles.english: crazy journey, really thinking:
subtitles.chinese: 瘋狂的旅程，真實的思考：

subtitles.english: we might all be just a little bit closer to being on a kill list we might like to think.
subtitles.chinese: 我們可能都離我們所想的殺戮名單更近了一點。

subtitles.chinese: 非常感謝大家。

subtitles.english: When the little boy said the emperor was naked, he wasn't telling them anything they didn't already know.
But he added to their knowledge nonetheless.
By blurting out what everyone could see within earshot of the others,
he ensured that everyone knew that everyone else knew what they knew, that everyone knew that, and so on.
And that changed their relationship with the emperor from obsequious deference to ridicule and scorn.
Hans Christian Andersen's immortal story draws on a momentous logical distinction.
